title: Manchester United skipper Wayne Rooney deserves a proper send off, says Stan Collymore
text:
Sport Manchester United skipper Wayne Rooney deserves a proper send off, says Stan Collymore Mirror columnist Collymore doesn't want the Red Devils' all-time top scorer to have a farewell long after he's left - like Frank Lampard at Chelsea Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Stan Collymore on Wayne Rooney leaving Manchester United Share this video Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Stan Collymore has called for Wayne Rooney to be given a proper send-off when he does eventually leave Manchester United. 
Frank Lampard returned to Chelsea for a farewell during their game against Swansea on Saturday, despite leaving Stamford Bridge in the summer of 2014. 
And Mirror columnist Collymore doesn't want to see Rooney experience the same fate. 
The Old Trafford skipper secured his name in the folklore of the club by becoming their all-time top goal scorer earlier this season. Rooney has struggled for first-team football so far this season (Photo: REUTERS) Lampard at Stamford Bridge on Saturday (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
He has been linked with a switch to the Chinese Super League which would see him become the highest-paid player in the world. 
Rooney has confirmed he will not be leaving United until the end of the season, but Collymore says his final game should be an occasion. 
“I want to see Wayne Rooney on the last home game of the season, like Liverpool did Sami Hyypia, Steven Gerrard and Jamie Carragher, have a nice mosaic and a nice send off for him. The Blues legend gave a speech to the crowd (Photo: Getty) Rooney continues to be linked with a move to China (Photo: Clive Mason) Read More Manchester United vs Southampton live score, goal updates and analysis from the EFL Cup final at Wembley 
“I think everyone would feel much better with themselves. 
"Frank Lampard at Chelsea, he’s had to come back two years after he’s finished at Chelsea and just get to walk around the pitch at half time." poll loading Is Rooney right to stay at Manchester United? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
